You can set fan speed but the miner (claymore) will control it anyways. You should disable fan control in miner config for this to work. Put
You should use this parameter with 'Mem Clock' setting.

RX cards known to have 1 or 2 memory states (actually 3 including 0 idle state). By default the highest state will be selected. But some rare cards are known to fail to undervolt on the highest state and required to select a lower one. For example the highest is 2 and for undervolting you would want to set state 1.
This is a very advanced parameter. Try this if there are problems with undervolting. If it works - don't touch this.
state will be used to set the voltage.
This is required if you try to undervolt you card. And you MUST set 'Core State' or default
This is required if you try to undervolt you card. You should use this parameter with 'Core Clock' setting and 'Core Voltage'.
If 'Core State' is unset, then the default
Set core clock here, a good value would be around
state will be used to set the clock.

Be careful! Always prepare physical or network access (SSH) to the worker before you change this setting. If the worker is not able to connect to selected URL it will become Offline for Hive. Mirror URL is saved in /hive-config/rig.conf where you can edit it manually.
If you leave it as 'Default' then Hive can decide where to connect. Usually it will be the first in the list.

If you have problems with connecting hive server from your worker and have often false Offline/Online events, then you can try to choose different server connection URL. Sometimes there is problem with firewall (your own or ISP) and switching port would help.

You can give control access to your farm to other users, for example, you could give Full Access privileges to your admins in order for them to manage everything in your stead. Or you can give the read-only Monitor access privileges to your technical staff that do simple maintenance and monitoring and nothing more.
